data.title: Derry boss Damien Barton blasts Enda Lynn for lining out for his club before Waterford clash
meta_keywords: Derry boss Damien Barton blasts Enda Lynn for lining out for his club before Waterford clash
data.meta_description: The Oakleaf captain aggravated a hamstring injury just days before his county's qualifier
data.text:
DERRY boss Damien Barton has criticised captain Enda Lynn for lining out with his club in the lead-up to Saturday’s qualifier win over Waterford.

The Greenlough forward aggravated a hamstring injury when he came on in the second half against Slaughtneil.

Barton said: “Enda didn’t start because he participated in a league game stupidly on Monday night.

“Enda is crazy whenever it comes to football and whenever it comes to training.

“Against Slaughtneil, they were 0-3 to 0-2 down at half-time so Enda thought he could do something.

“He re-aggravated a hamstring injury, which was stupid on his part.”

After the loss at Fraher Field, Déise gaffer Tom McGlinchey claims he is unsure about his future.

He said: “I’ve got a great relationship with the county board, with the players and with our tight-knit group of supporters.

“I’ve loved my time in Waterford but it’s not the time to talk about that, there’s wounds to be licked.”

Derry — who were knocked out of Ulster in the quarter-finals by Tyrone — shot 17 wides at Fraher Field.

Barton added: “After the Tyrone game, it was important to get moving. We’ve some young players and they acquitted themselves very well.”

DERRY: B McKinless; N Keenan 0-1, B Rogers, K McKaigue 0-1; M McEvoy, C McWilliams, C McFaul 0-2; C McAtamney, C McKaigue; J Kielt 0-3, 2f, B Heron, D Tallon 0-3; R Bell 0-2, D Heavron 1-1, N Loughlin 0-2. Subs: E McGuckin 0-1 for Loughlin h-t, M Lynch 0-1 for Bell 45 mins, S McGuigan for Kielt 48, N Forrester for McFaul 55, C Nevin for McAtamney 60, G O’Neill for Heron 63.

WATERFORD: S Enright; A Trihy, T O’Gorman, S Dalton; C Murray, R O Ceallaigh, J McGrath; T Prendergast, M Curry; J Veale, P Whyte 0-1, S Prendergast 0-2; D Breathnach 0-5, 3f, F Ó Cuirrín 0-2, G Crotty 0-3. Subs: M O’Halloran for McGrath 17 mins, b-c, P Hurney for Veale 47, D Guiry for Murray 50, L Ó Corraoin for Dalton 54, F Galvin for Ó Cuirrín 61, K Murphy for Prendergast 71.

REFEREE: J Henry (Mayo).
